text: The tribe of Manasseh, Joseph’s firstborn son, was also allotted land. The descendants of Makir, Manasseh’s firstborn and the father of Gilead, received land, for they were warriors. They were assigned Gilead and Bashan.

The rest of Manasseh’s descendants were also assigned land by their clans, including the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These are the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph by their clans.
Now Zelophehad son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Makir, son of Manasseh, had no sons, only daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

They went before Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders and said, “The Lord told Moses to assign us land among our relatives.” So Joshua assigned them land among their uncles, as the Lord had commanded.

<st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> was <st data-num="05307" class="">allotted</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="02256" class="">shares of land</st>,<n id="1" /> in <st data-num="0905" class="">addition</st> to the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> and <st data-num="01316" class="">Bashan</st> <st data-num="0834 05676">east</st> of the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>,
for the daughters of Manasseh were assigned land among his sons. The land of Gilead belonged to the rest of the descendants of Manasseh.
The border of Manasseh went from Asher to Micmethath, which is near Shechem. It then went south toward those who live by En Tappuah.

(The <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="08599" class="">Tappuah</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">belonged</st> to <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>, but <st data-num="08599" class="">Tappuah</st>, located <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>, belonged to the <st data-num="01121" class="">tribe</st> of <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st>.)

The <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> then <st data-num="03381" class="">descended</st> <st data-num="05045 05158">southward</st> to the <st data-num="05158" class="">Valley</st> of <st data-num="07071" class="">Kanah</st>. <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> was assigned <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">there</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>,<n id="1" /> but the <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> was <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> of the <st data-num="05158" class="">valley</st> and <st data-num="01961 08444">ended</st> at the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>.

<st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim’s</st> territory was to the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st>, and <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh’s</st> to the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st>. The <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> Manasseh’s<n id="1" /> western <st data-num="01366" class="">border</st>, and their territory<n id="2" /> <st data-num="06293" class="">touched</st> <st data-num="0836" class="">Asher</st> on the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> and <st data-num="03485" class="">Issachar</st> on the <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st>.

Within <st data-num="03485" class="">Issachar’s</st> and <st data-num="0836" class="">Asher’s</st> territories <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> assigned <st data-num="01052" class="">Beth Shean</st>, <st data-num="02991" class="">Ibleam</st>, the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="01756" class="">Dor</st>, the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="05874" class="">Endor</st>, the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="08590" class="">Taanach</st>, the <st data-num="03427" class="">residents</st> of <st data-num="04023" class="">Megiddo</st>,<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> of <st data-num="05316" class="">Napheth</st>,<n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="01323" class="">towns</st> surrounding all these cities.<n id="3" />

But the <st data-num="01121" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> were <st data-num="03808 03201">unable</st> to <st data-num="03423" class="">conquer</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st>; the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st> <st data-num="02974" class="">managed</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="03427" class="">remain</st> in <st data-num="02063" class="">those</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">areas</st>.
Whenever the Israelites were strong militarily, they forced the Canaanites to do hard labor, but they never totally conquered them.
The descendants of Joseph said to Joshua, “Why have you assigned us only one tribal allotment? After all, we have many people, for until now the Lord has enabled us to increase in number.”

<st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, “<st data-num="0518" class="">Since</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> have so <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05927" class="">go up</st> into the <st data-num="03293" class="">forest</st> and <st data-num="01254" class="">clear out</st> a <st data-num="08033" class="">place</st> to live in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="06522" class="">Perizzites</st> and <st data-num="07497" class="">Rephaites</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> the <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st> of <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> is too <st data-num="0213" class="">small</st> for you.”

The <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “The whole <st data-num="02022" class="">hill country</st><n id="1" /> is <st data-num="03808 04672">inadequate</st> for us, and the <st data-num="03605 03669">Canaanites</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">down</st> in the <st data-num="06010 0834">valley</st> in <st data-num="01052" class="">Beth Shean</st> and its surrounding <st data-num="01323" class="">towns</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">and</st> in the <st data-num="06010" class="">Valley</st> of <st data-num="03157" class="">Jezreel</st> have <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> with <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st>-rimmed wheels.”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="03091" class="">Joshua</st> <st data-num="0559 0559">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>—to both <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> and <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>: “<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> have <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> military <st data-num="03581" class="">strength</st>. You will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">have</st> just <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> tribal <st data-num="01486" class="">allotment</st>.

The whole hill country will be yours; though it is a forest, you can clear it, and it will be entirely yours. You can conquer the Canaanites, though they have chariots with iron-rimmed wheels and are strong.”
